timeline.bodyText: path needs to include the unfound artifact; otherwise we cannot tell the scope / optional of the dependency.
timeline.author: suztomo

replies.bodyText: Let me double check, but I think that would be a behavioral change from the current code
replies.author: elharo

replies.bodyText: OK, I think you're right though the code is a little hard to follow. The parentNodes stack variable might be poorly named. In any case I can make this doc comment ambiguous enough to cover both cases, and this PR does not change the behavior
replies.author: elharo

replies.bodyText: The parentNodes do not have the node being checked. ExceptionAndPath was combining them to make the dependency path for UnresolvableArtifactProblem.
replies.author: suztomo

replies.bodyText:
The parentNodes do not have the node being checked.

This was wrong.
replies.author: suztomo

revised_code.chunk:
diff --git a/dependencies/src/main/java/com/google/cloud/tools/opensource/dependencies/UnresolvableArtifactProblem.java b/dependencies/src/main/java/com/google/cloud/tools/opensource/dependencies/UnresolvableArtifactProblem.java
index 3427ca92..502b53c1 100644
--- a/dependencies/src/main/java/com/google/cloud/tools/opensource/dependencies/UnresolvableArtifactProblem.java
+++ b/dependencies/src/main/java/com/google/cloud/tools/opensource/dependencies/UnresolvableArtifactProblem.java

@@ -48,7 +48,7 @@ public final class UnresolvableArtifactProblem extends ArtifactProblem {
    * dependency tree.
    * 
    * @param artifact dependency that can't be found
-   * @param path to the unfound artifact, not including the unfound artifact
+   * @param path to the unfound artifact
    */
   public UnresolvableArtifactProblem(Artifact artifact, Collection<DependencyNode> path) {
     super(artifact, path);

timeline.bodyText:
Why does this needs to be changed to Collection?

As we care about the order of the dependency path, List is appropriate.
I see Stack implements List interface. https://docs.oracle.com/javase/8/docs/api/java/util/Stack.html.
timeline.author: suztomo

replies.bodyText: OK, fixed, though stacks being a subclass of List is a long-recognized problem in the Java Collections API since it violates the ADT for stack.
replies.author: elharo

timeline.bodyText:
Memo: The parentNodes.push(dependencyNode) happens at line 327 (before this line). Therefore, the code should behave the same as the previous one.
Shall we rename the variable at the line 327?
timeline.author: suztomo

replies.bodyText: This feels like more a comment about what the method does rather than why the test failed. When I ran the test this message pushed the actual diff out of the way.
